definition: to imagine that one's love is reciprocated/to shower affection on an uninterested party
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: He flattered himself that she liked him!
Thank u for let me absolutely realize that love can fade with the seasons.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你让我知道我有多么地自作多情。

sentences.english: I know, I was just the worry, eventually fell unfounded worry.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，我的担心，最终只是被沦为了自作多情。

sentences.english: Enthusiasm for the wrong man, what is love.
sentences.chinese: 热情对错了人，做什么都是自作多情。

sentences.english: Sometimes, wishful thinking or self-assertion is in bring trouble on oneself.
sentences.chinese: 有时候啊，一厢情愿或者自作多情都是在自寻烦恼。

sentences.english: It’s not aimed at me, so why waste so much energy being upset about it?
sentences.chinese: 所以，为什么要浪费这么多精力而自作多情呢？

sentences.english: Self-delusion about one's own attractiveness is a prerequisite to every happy marriage.
sentences.chinese: 自作多情是每一段美好姻缘的必要前提。

sentences.english: Too many fond hope is to beg the other side of charity.
sentences.chinese: 过多的自作多情是在乞求对方的施舍。

sentences.english: Too much self- assertion is begging each other 's charity.
sentences.chinese: 过多的自作多情是在乞求对方的施舍。

definition: lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
